data.title: Mr. Raymond Leach Obituary 2012
data.meta_description: Mr. Raymond E. (Ray) Leach a longtime Millington resident passed from our world into God's Kingdom early Friday afternoon April 6, 2012 while at the Covenant Health Care Center...
data.text:
Mr. Raymond E. (Ray) Leach a longtime Millington resident passed from our world into God's Kingdom early Friday afternoon April 6, 2012 while at the Covenant Health Care Center Cooper Campus in Saginaw Ray was 72.

The son of Clare & Lila (Kowitz) Leach Ray was born in Watertown Township of Fostoria Michigan on November 29, 1939. On March 10, 1962 Ray married Miss Judith (Judy) Harpham and together she and Ray have celebrated 50 years of marriage. For 30 years Ray was employed with Dalrymple Appliance Store in Millington until its closing. In 1981 Ray became the head Custodian at the St. Paul Lutheran School where he worked for the next 21 years until his retirement in 2002. Ray was also a member of St. Paul Lutheran Church, where he served the church and the school in many ways other than the Custodian.

Ray leave his wife Judy, two sons and daughter in-laws, Raymond & Angel Leach, Byron & Jennifer Leach, a daughter Shelley Coon, ten grandchildren, and four great grandchildren, one brother Ronald Leach, four sisters; Marleah Hoard, Joyce Schmitzer, Irma Mason, and Bernice Carr, as well as several nieces, nephews, and extended family. Ray is preceded in death by two brothers, George and William Leach, a sister Helen Long and a sister in-law Barbara Leach.

You're welcome to leave and express personal condolences,share a memory, or light a memory candle by opening the Memory Wall tab, for visitation and service information open the Service Info tab.

HANLIN FUNERAL HOME

A Family Serving Families

for 84 years.

HANLIN FUNERAL HOME

A Family serving Families

for 84 years.

Service Information

Honoring Ray's wishes cremation has taken place. A memorial service was held Saturday April 14, 2012 at the St. Paul Lutheran Church in Millington. Pastor James Bruner delivered the memorial message and the closing prayers. Memorial gifts of remembrance can be directed to St. Paul Lutheran Church.

You're welcome to leave personal condolences, share a memory, or light a memory candle by opening the Memory Wall tab, for a complete obituary open the Obituary Tab.
